resources.string: SEATTLE\'S AWARD-WINNING, HALL-OF-FAME CHOWDER CAFES NAMED AMERICA\'S #1 AND SEATTLE\'S BEST, SERVING 8 VARIETIES DAILY
Seattle\'s first cupcake bakery, home to the best cupcakes and award-winning ice cream! Delivery and easy online ordering for parties, weddings and celebrations
Homemade ice cream and fresh waffle cones, Unique seasonal flavors.
Fresh ingredients on a classic never frozen hamburger, hand dipped shakes and fresh cut fries daily.
Asian specialty products and a variety of dines and shops to explore. Features Kinokuniya Bookstore and Beard Papa\'s Cream Puffs
Pacific Place is an upscale shopping center located in downtown Seattle, Washington

Pike Place Market is a public market overlooking the Elliott Bay waterfront in Seattle, Washington, United States. The Market opened August 17, 1907, and is one of the oldest continuously operated public farmers\' markets in the United States.
1st Ave and Pike St., Seattle, WA 98101
The most notable piece of the iconic Seattle Skyline The Space Needle built in 1962, contains glass floors with an observation deck at 520 ft (160 m) and the rotating SkyCity restaurant at 500 ft

Originally opened in 1977 the Seattle Aquarium no owned by a non profit promote conservation of aquatic life forms. The Aquarium boasts an impressive 120,000-gallon exhibit, a gift shop, caf\é, and a meeting/event space.

The Pacific Science Center began as the United States Science Pavilion during the 1962 Seattle World\'s Fair. The center has award-winning, interactive programs reach more than 1.1 million people each year spreading the love of science.

The historic pier where in 1897 the steamship Portland with it\'s first load of gold from the Klondike docked. Now known as Pier 57 the Miners Landing is a family-friendly spot with lots of shops, restaurants, and entertainment.
The Museum of Pop Culture, or MoPOP is a nonprofit museum dedicated to contemporary popular culture. It was founded by Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen in 2000 as the Experience Music Project.

Chihuly Garden and Glass is an exhibit in the Seattle Center showcasing the studio glass of Dale Chihuly. The exhibit opened in May 2012, it contains 3 main components :the Garden, the Glasshouse, and the Interior Exhibits, with significant secondary spaces including a caf\'e

The Museum of Flight is a private non-profit air and space museum in the northwest United States. Established in 1965 the museum is fully accredited by the American Alliance of Museums it is known as the largest private air and space museum in the world
9404 E Marginal Way S, Seattle, WA 98108

Established in 1933 the Seattle Art Museum has three facilities: the main museum in downtown Seattle; the Seattle Asian Art Museum (SAAM) in Volunteer Park on Capitol Hill, and the open Olympic Sculpture Park on the central Seattle waterfront, which opened on January 20, 2007. The SAM collection has grown from 1,926 pieces in 1933 to nearly 25,000 as of 2008.
